notes: The intelligence talent effectively grants Skywrath Mage 120 mana, 0.5 mana regeneration, and 10 attack damage.
The health talent increases maximum health capacity, and keeps the current health percentage.
The bolt travels at a speed of 500.
Every 25 intelligence grants 35 bonus damage.

Checks Skywrath Mage's intelligence upon releasing the projectile. This means that the projectile's damage is set upon launch and does not adapt when losing or gaining intelligence. The projectile has a 325 radius flying vision. This vision does not linger. Also provides the same vision at the target's location for 3.34 seconds upon successfully hitting it.
This means that the projectile's damage is set upon launch and does not adapt when losing or gaining intelligence.

With the level 15 talent, whenever Arcane Bolt is cast, 1 different random target within the search radius is also targeted. A total of 2 Arcane Bolts is released this way. The search radius is centered around the primary target, not around Skywrath Mage. Since it uses a defined radius and is not based on the cast range, it is not affected by cast range modifying abilities (e.g. Aether Lens). Heroes and illusions have a higher priority than other units. Treats creep-heroes as creeps. If no other valid targets are found within the search radius, the second Arcane Bolt is not released.
A total of 2 Arcane Bolts is released this way.

abilities.description: Skywrath Mage launches a slow-moving bolt of arcane magic, dealing damage to an enemy unit based on Skywrath Mage's intelligence.
params: When Skywrath Mage casts Arcane Bolt, a different random target within 700 range willl be hit with the same ability. Heroes will take priority.
Does not pierce spell immunity. Fully pierces spell immunity.
Blocked upon impact, as primary and secondary target.
Within the Ghastly Eyrie's endless intrigue, only the clever and calm can hope to survive.
abilities.story: Within the Ghastly Eyrie's endless intrigue, only the clever and calm can hope to survive.

notes: Concussive Shot interrupts Skywrath Mage's channeling abilities upon cast.

Concussive Shot travels at a speed of 800. The projectile has 300 radius flying vision. This vision does not linger. Also provides the same vision at the target's location for 3.34 seconds upon successfully hitting it.
The projectile has 300 radius flying vision. This vision does not linger.
Also provides the same vision at the target's location for 3.34 seconds upon successfully hitting it.

Does not target invisible, invulnerable or hidden units or units in the Fog of War. Does target Meepo Clones and Tempest Doubles. When no visible heroes are nearby, the ability targets the closest creep instead. The area damage and slow fully affect creeps and summons in range, dealing 75/120/165/210 damage to them. The vision and targeting notes fully apply for the Global Concussive Shot talent.

params: When Skywrath Mage casts Concussive Shot, a different random target within cast range will be hit with the same ability. Heroes will take priority.

Disjointing the projectile causes it to completely fizzle.
Those who serve the court of the Ghastly Eyrie are ever locked in covert war. One must always know where danger lurks nearest.

notes: Silence and reduces most heroes' total magic resistance to 2%/-1%/-5%/-9% (TagTalent -7%/-10%/-14%/-18%). The magic resistance reduction does not affect non-hero units.
The magic resistance reduction does not affect non-hero units.
Successive casts on the same target do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.

The search radius is centered around the primary target, not around Skywrath Mage. Heroes and illusions have a higher priority than other units. Treats creep-heroes as creeps. If no other valid targets are found within the search radius, the second Ancient Seal is not applied.

notes: Only heroes are affected. The damage completely ignores illusions, clones and creep-heroes, or spell immune, invulnerable and hidden units.
The damage completely ignores illusions, clones and creep-heroes, or spell immune, invulnerable and hidden units.
Deals damage in 0.1-second intervals, starting 0.1 seconds after ability cast, resulting in 24 damage instances.

This is how much damage Mystic Flare deals when hitting a certain amount of units for the full duration (before reductions): 1 Unit(s): 31.25/48.96/66.67 (TagTalent 50/67.71/85.42) per interval, and 750/1175/1600 (TagTalent 1200/1625/2050) total damage. 2 Unit(s): 15.63/24.48/33.33 (TagTalent 25/33.85/42.71) per interval, and 375/587.5/800 (TagTalent 600/812.5/1025) total damage. 3 Unit(s): 10.42/16.32/22.22 (TagTalent 16.67/22.57/28.47) per interval, and 250/391.67/533.33 (TagTalent 400/541.67/683.33) total damage. 4 Unit(s): 7.81/12.24/16.67 (TagTalent 12.5/16.93/21.35) per interval, and 187.5/293.75/400 (TagTalent 300/406.25/512.5) total damage. 5 Unit(s): 6.25/9.79/13.33 (TagTalent 10/13.54/17.08) per interval, and 150/235/320 (TagTalent 240/325/410) total damage.

A hidden debuff is responsible for the particle effects on hit enemies. It has only visual purposes. The debuff is placed by an aura, and lingers for 0.5 seconds.
The debuff is placed by an aura, and lingers for 0.5 seconds.

With Aghanim's Scepter, casting Mystic Flare automatically casts another Mystic Flare centered on a random enemy within the search radius but outside the 170 effect radius. A total of 2 Mystic Flare is released this way. The search radius is centered around the targeted area, not around Skywrath Mage. Heroes and illusions have a higher priority than other units. Treats creep-heroes as creeps. Ignores spell immune or invulnerable units within the search radius. If no other valid targets are found within the search radius, the second Mystic Flare is not released.

abilities.description: Skywrath Mage uses his ultimate magical ability to conjure a precise and violent mystical field that lays waste to his adversaries. Deals massive damage distributed evenly among any Heroes in the area over seconds.
params: When Skywrath Mage casts Mystic Flare, another Mystic Flare will be created on the position of a different random target enemy within 700 range. Heroes will take priority
Only the most practiced of Skywrath sorcerers could hope to shape the skies into such a storm.
abilities.story: Only the most practiced of Skywrath sorcerers could hope to shape the skies into such a storm.

notes: Requires Aghanim's Shard to be unlocked.
Each cast refreshes the duration of the whole stack while adding one to the stack counter.
Abilities upgraded by talent or Aghanim's Scepter targeting multiple heroes grant one stack.
abilities.description: Every time you cast abilities you gain +5 Intelligence and +1 Armor for 35 seconds. Stacks independently.

description: Dragonus, the Skywrath Mage, is a ranged intelligence hero equipped with tremendously powerful nukes, able to enhance magical damage and thus scales well into late game. However, he is a proverbial glass cannon; while he can bring superb amounts of damage, he is dangerously vulnerable and will most likely meet a swift end if the player isn't careful. Arcane Bolt is his main spell; its damage is based on his current Intelligence level. Concussive Shot blasts the nearest enemy hero, along with nearby units around the foe, slowing them down. The Ancient Seal marks the target with magic amplification and silence, leaving the target vulnerable to magic and unable to cast spells. Skywrath Mage's ultimate Mystic Flare is one of the most dangerous nukes in the game. Enemy heroes caught in this field will suffer massive damage. Its power is split equally among enemy heroes within its radius; if it is used on a single hero, it will deal its full damage potential. His spells are most effective when targeted on a lone hero and thus suffer decreased effectiveness when used on groups.
history: A highly placed mage in the court of the Ghastly Eyrie, Dragonus lives a troubled existence. Sworn by birth to protect whoever sits within the Nest of Thorns, he hates the current Skywrath queen with all his soul. As a youth, high-born, he was a friend and companion to the eldest Skywrath princess, Shendelzare, first in line for the Nest. He had loved her warmly and unshakably, but as his studies took hold, his mind turned to arcane learning and the mastery of Skywrath sorcery. Obsessed with matters aetherial, he missed the mundane signs of courtly treachery that hinted at a plot against Shendelzare, and lost his chance to foil it. When the court was shaken by a swift and violent coup, he emerged from his studies to discover his oldest and dearest friend had been lost to him. The Nest of Thorns now belonged to Shendelzare's ruthless younger sister, and Dragonus could do nothing. The magic of the Skywrath Mage serves only the sworn protector of the Skywrath scion, so to act against the Nest would render him helpless. He clings to his post, believing it to be the best hope of one day restoring his true love to her rightful place. Meanwhile, his secret is known only to the goddess Scree'auk, whose magic it was transformed Shendelzare from a crippled physical creature into an embodiment of pure vengeful energy. While he dreams of restoring his beloved queen to the Ghastly Eyrie, he dreams even more desperately of restoring Shendelzare herself to a fully healed physical form. The duplicity of his role at court tortures him, for he is a noble and good-hearted creature; but the worst torture of all is imagining the hatred that Vengeful Spirit must hold in her heart for him.
